raw_json.html_title: Create multiple graphics in R without multiple calls to pdf / postscript / jpeg / png | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
Create multiple graphics in R without multiple calls to pdf / postscript / jpeg / png

Posted on May 14, 2009 by Vinh Nguyen in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Super Nerdy Cool » R, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

To save multiple graphics, e.g, Rplot001.pdf, Rplot002.pdf, …, Rplot050.pdf, we don’t have to call pdf() 50 times (or any similar function).

Use “Rplot%03d.pdf” for filename in pdf() and each plot() call will be saved to a new pdf file. Use dev.off() once at the end to close all devices!

check out ?sprintf for more information about %03 and other C-style string formatting.

Related

To leave a comment for the author, please follow the link and comment on their blog: Super Nerdy Cool » R.
